result.execSummary:
The defendant John P Sporer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Criminal Arrest, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight time.(No work release)  Sentence credit for 74 days were granted.
Consecutive to: any other sentence.

miscConds.notes: Bail applied to costs.  Remainder of costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of alcohol. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
